intro: Stigmaphyllon grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leaved stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it is found.
